issue.title: GitHub action fails silently
issue.body:
There is an edge case where the action will fail silently, and mark the job as succeeded.

The input `scan-url` for the action is required. However, the run can still fail if an empty string is passed during the run. In my case, I was passing the output of another job.

## Expected Behavior

Job failure.

## Current Behavior

Job passing with the following logs.

```
Run lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
Woops! You forgot to provide a URL of a website to scan.
25l? Please provide a URL to scan: ‣  25h
```

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

```
  snyk:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
        uses: lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
        with:
          scan-url: ${{ inputs.url }}
```

commits.message: fix: an empty URL in CI will prompt for input instead of crashing (#102)

issue.title: docs: updating README for more clear directions
issue.body:
This GitHub Actions README page was a bit confusing. While it is said to be deprecated, it isn't entirely clear how to use Playwright in a GitHub Actions CI, and also the usage section for the GitHub Actions workflow was still very much apparent, creating more confusion.

This PR introduces:
- Clearer "DOs and DONTs"
- Shows a GitHub Actions workflow CI configuration
- Elaborate on why it is deprecated
- Cleans up the README

issue.title: Introduced common layout functions
issue.body:
With this big commit I am introducing a standardized way of outputting pages to end user.
Most of these functions are in **layout.php**, **page_commons.php** and **page_numberings.php**

This commit also fixes graph and table views.
In particular, I have fixed part of the libchart latest version code which appears to be incompatible with PHP 8.1.2 (I proposed a [PR](https://github.com/naku/libchart/pull/28) ontheir repo, too).

Also I keep sanitizing and validating user-input (which should always be a priority).

As UI improvement I have started developing the experimental **2.css** file.
When ready we could switch to the new UI just by changing **1.css** with **2.css** in the **layout.php** file.

An example of how the new UI could look like is this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4223503/198984881-882d5e9d-d6a6-4541-aa47-297b5632859c.png)

issue.title: GitHub action fails silently
issue.body:
There is an edge case where the action will fail silently, and mark the job as succeeded.

The input `scan-url` for the action is required. However, the run can still fail if an empty string is passed during the run. In my case, I was passing the output of another job.

## Expected Behavior

Job failure.

## Current Behavior

Job passing with the following logs.

```
Run lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
Woops! You forgot to provide a URL of a website to scan.
25l? Please provide a URL to scan: ‣  25h
```

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

```
  snyk:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
        uses: lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
        with:
          scan-url: ${{ inputs.url }}
```

commits.message: fix: an empty URL in CI will prompt for input instead of crashing (#102)

issue.title: GitHub action fails silently
issue.body:
There is an edge case where the action will fail silently, and mark the job as succeeded.

The input `scan-url` for the action is required. However, the run can still fail if an empty string is passed during the run. In my case, I was passing the output of another job.

## Expected Behavior

Job failure.

## Current Behavior

Job passing with the following logs.

```
Run lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
Woops! You forgot to provide a URL of a website to scan.
25l? Please provide a URL to scan: ‣  25h
```

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

```
  snyk:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
        uses: lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
        with:
          scan-url: ${{ inputs.url }}
```

- Elaborate on why it is deprecated
- Cleans up the README

issue.title: Introduced common layout functions
issue.body:
With this big commit I am introducing a standardized way of outputting pages to end user.
Most of these functions are in **layout.php**, **page_commons.php** and **page_numberings.php**

This commit also fixes graph and table views.
In particular, I have fixed part of the libchart latest version code which appears to be incompatible with PHP 8.1.2 (I proposed a [PR](https://github.com/naku/libchart/pull/28) ontheir repo, too).

Also I keep sanitizing and validating user-input (which should always be a priority).

As UI improvement I have started developing the experimental **2.css** file.
When ready we could switch to the new UI just by changing **1.css** with **2.css** in the **layout.php** file.

An example of how the new UI could look like is this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4223503/198984881-882d5e9d-d6a6-4541-aa47-297b5632859c.png)

issue.title: GitHub action fails silently
issue.body:
There is an edge case where the action will fail silently, and mark the job as succeeded.

The input `scan-url` for the action is required. However, the run can still fail if an empty string is passed during the run. In my case, I was passing the output of another job.

## Expected Behavior

Job failure.

## Current Behavior

Job passing with the following logs.

```
Run lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
Woops! You forgot to provide a URL of a website to scan.
25l? Please provide a URL to scan: ‣  25h
```

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

```
  snyk:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
        uses: lirantal/is-website-vulnerable@master
        with:
          scan-url: ${{ inputs.url }}
```

This GitHub Actions README page was a bit confusing. While it is said to be deprecated, it isn't entirely clear how to use Playwright in a GitHub Actions CI, and also the usage section for the GitHub Actions workflow was still very much apparent, creating more confusion.

This PR introduces:
- Clearer "DOs and DONTs"
- Shows a GitHub Actions workflow CI configuration
- Elaborate on why it is deprecated
- Cleans up the README

issue.title: Introduced common layout functions
issue.body:
With this big commit I am introducing a standardized way of outputting pages to end user.
Most of these functions are in **layout.php**, **page_commons.php** and **page_numberings.php**

This commit also fixes graph and table views.
In particular, I have fixed part of the libchart latest version code which appears to be incompatible with PHP 8.1.2 (I proposed a [PR](https://github.com/naku/libchart/pull/28) ontheir repo, too).

Also I keep sanitizing and validating user-input (which should always be a priority).

As UI improvement I have started developing the experimental **2.css** file.
When ready we could switch to the new UI just by changing **1.css** with **2.css** in the **layout.php** file.

An example of how the new UI could look like is this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4223503/198984881-882d5e9d-d6a6-4541-aa47-297b5632859c.png)
